career-path.career-subheading: Software Testing Education Program at Per Scholas
career-path.career-text: Graduated from the Software Testing Education Program (STEP) at Per Scholas that included a 9-week training on Rapid Testing Intensive (RTI) and Rapid Software Testing (RST) created by James Bach of Satisfice. Part of the training included working on projects within small teams to test a flash-based game, mind-mapping application and others that required the need to write formal bug reports, prepared outlines of risks and areas to test, as well as a final report

career-path.career-subheading: Software QA Engineer Intern at EKO Communications
career-path.career-text:
Performed manual testing of mobile applications on Android and iOS devices
• Tested a web-based application
• Identified potential risks and created a risk analysis report
• Created Product Coverage Outline using mind maps
• Wrote and executed test cases for regression testing of new builds of an application
• Evaluated quality of a product on different stages of its development
• Created comprehensive database of documented test defects and procedures to enable accurate replication and ensure compliance with standards

career-path.career-subheading: Web Development Immersive Bootcamp at General Assembly
career-path.career-text:
During a 3-month course, I Built a Wiki App using Node.js, Express.js, SQLite3
• Created a Contacts Manager app using JavaScript, Semantic-UI, Mustache.js, jQuery, JSON-Server.
• Developed a Travel planning app using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap and PostgreSQL
• Built a Meetup Events scheduling application with a small group, using Backbone.js and Ruby on Rails

career-path.career-subheading: Back End Web Developer at NYC Devshop
career-path.career-text:
Developed an MVP of a large scale Ruby on Rails application
• Integrated user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server logic
• Integrated 15+ social media & financial/accounting APIs into the app to perform calculations needed for the project‘s logic
• Performed testing of the application features. Fixed application bugs
• Maintained code quality and organization

• Worked on Developing Front-End for the main site using HTML/LESS/JavaScript
 • Coded HTML Emails.
 • Ran Unit Tests.
 Environment: ASP.Net, C#, MySQL, HTML, CSS/Less, JavaScript, Visual Studio, Source Control

• Developing functional and smooth, easy-to-operate and eyecatching web application 
 •  Performing website maintenance and enhancements 
 •  Providing assistance to the back-end developers in troubleshooting and coding

skills.skill-text: Open source framework for Web development in Ruby, an object-oriented programming (OOP) language similar to Perl and Python.
Object-oriented computer programming language commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.
Fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library designed to simplify the client-side scripting of HTML.

HTML (the Hypertext Markup Language) and CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) are two of the core technologies for building Web pages. HTML provides the structure of the page, CSS the (visual and aural) layout, for a variety of devices.

Scripting language that is interpreted into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). SassScript is the scripting language itself. Sass consists of two syntaxes. The original syntax, called 'the indented syntax', uses a syntax similar to Haml.

Open-source collection of tools for creating websites and web applications. It contains HTML- and CSS-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation and other interface components, as well as optional JavaScript extensions.
Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform runtime environment for developing server-side web applications. Express.js is the most popular Node.js web application framework used today.
Open source Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) that uses Structured Query Language (SQL). It is most noted for its quick processing, proven reliability, ease and flexibility of use.
Open source relational database management system ( DBMS ) developed by a worldwide team of volunteers. It has earned a strong reputation for reliability, data integrity, and correctness.

modal-details.modal-intro: Pack'N'Roll is an application to help users plan and pack for upcoming trips.
modal-details.modal-stack-list:
• Ruby On Rails
  • JavaScript
  • jQuery
  • HTML/CSS
  • PostgreSQL
    • 10 API integrated:
  • Exchange Rates API
  • Autocomplete City API
  • Google Maps API
  • TimeZoneDB API
  • Weather Underground API
  • IP Address Geolocation API
  • Facebook Oauth API
  • Google Oauth API
  • Linkedin Oauth API
  • Github Oauth API
modal-details.app-features:
User can create a personal account (sign up / log in) and edit his/her profile settings.

User can create a Trip by adding a destination name, start date and end date of the planned trip and choose the activities planned.

Once the trip is created, user can check current weather for the destination location as well as see the distance between 2 locations on the map.

The trip can be updated or deleted. On the trip page, a user is provided with the list of suggested items to pack (by category).Custom items can be added on the same page. User can mark items as packed and save or print current progress.User has access to a Calendar with all the planned trips to easily find and track past of future travel.

User can check the currency of a searched country and the currency calculator is available. Time difference between his/her current location and the destination is displayed on the world map.

modal-details.modal-intro: This collection includes my latest hobby - animations that do not use any JavaScript / jQuery. CSS3 is powerful enough on its own to create amazing effects.
This Appllication allows my friends to share their culinary skills with me by posting their recipes and teaching me how to cook :)
modal-details.app-features:
User can create a personal account (sign up / log in) and edit his/her profile settings.

Create a Recipe by uploading images and adding Ingredients and Directions

User can send a message notifying me that the Recipe is ready

modal-details.modal-intro: DatingApp is an application similar to Tinder, where users can like or dislike each other and be matched on mutual ineterests.
modal-details.modal-stack-list:
• Ruby On Rails
  • JavaScript
  • jQuery
  • HTML/CSS
  • SQLite3
  • Deployed to Digital Ocean using Apache and Passenger web servers and Capistrano Gem
modal-details.app-features:
Registration. A user can easily create a profile with 1-click sign-up through Facebook.

Match. If both users like each other, the 'Friendship' will be initiated, a user will get an alert

Get in contact. Once user is matched with another user, the email contact becomes available.

modal-details.modal-intro: Impromptu is all about spontenaity for the users, who have a couple hours and want to find something of interest. Impromptu has been created in collaboration with 4 students at General Aseembly Web Development Bootcamp as one of the assignments.
modal-details.app-features:
Finding an event. A user has the ability to see all events that match their interests but ONLY during times that they are available. This is done by having the user create time slots when they are 'normally free' on each day of the week. This schedule is then duplicated every week. Imromptu gives that specific user events at the beginning of each week. A user can also do custome searches if they suddenly find themselves having some available time during the week, eliminating the need for the user to go in and change their settings.

Hosting an event. Since every user has their 'normally free' times included in their profiles, someone who is looking to host an event can see when users (who will remain anonymous), that are interested in their topic, are free. These statistics allow the host to create their event at the most optimal time for the potential guests in the area. The host can also send out an email to all anonymous users as well, informing them of the event and why they should go.

modal-details.modal-intro: Trekabilly is a community website where individuals post tips about their own city and cities they’ve visited. Trekabilly was developed as part of a hackathon competition at General Assembly. The Hack challenged teams of developers, project managers and UX specialists to come up with a viable web app. The development cycle covered 2 sprints that followed the latest Agile development processes.
modal-details.modal-stack-list:
• Ruby on Rails
  • JavaScript
  • PostgreSQL - Database
  • Google Maps API
  • HTML5 & CSS3
  • MaterializeCSS
  • Draw.io - ERD
  • Adobe Illustator & Moqups.com - Wireframes
modal-details.app-features: Anyone looking to plan a trip will be able to search for posts by category, keyword, or location and receive results that talk about the whole city, not just the tourist bits. We’ll also integrate voting on posts to engage the community further and do an even better job of giving the most interesting results.

modal-details.modal-intro: Jobbo was created with intentions to help Job Seekers keep track of the applications they send out to employers.
modal-details.app-features:
User can create a personal account (sign up / log in) and edit his/her profile settings.

User can create/edit/delete a job application to track

Adding job description, cover letter, notes, date etc

User can change a status of his/her application
